intro: Eryngium bellidifolium, commonly known as the bellidifolium thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native range. Eryngium bellidifolium is also valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens.
